data.title: Qualified Content Definition
data.meta_description: Define Qualified Content. OwnerProvider‚Äù shall mean a n entityContent Provider which is an Eligible Content Distributor which has annual sales in immediately preceding three consecutive fiscal years from production and licensing of digital content of more than EURO 100 million, and licenses digital content for distribution in commercial quantities as Controlled Content.
data.text:
Before initiating the process to Revoke the applicable Host Certificate, CI Plus TA shall make a determination, in consultation with Qualified Operators and Qualified Content Owners,Eligible Content Distributors as to the specific level (ranging from an individual device to all devices from the manufacturer) at which the Revocation shallwould be performed., and communicate this information to all Eligible Content Distributors.

Notwithstanding the above, only a Qualified Operator or a Qualified Content Provider Owner which is an Eligible Content Distributor shall be entitled to seek damages pursuant to the terms of Section 3.4.

Notwithstanding the above, only a Qualified Operator or a Qualified Content Provider shall be entitled to seek damages pursuant to the terms of Section 3.4.

If a simple majority of Qualified Operators or Qualified Content Owners object within five (5) business days that the revocation level selected by CI Plus was not appropriate, then CI Plus shall either update the Revocation notice sent to the Licensee with the level proposed by the objecting parties or work with the objecting parties to resolve the issue within ten (10) business days.
